intro: Eurysolen, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with alternate, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences called cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both sunny and partially shaded environments.
